q: In his keynote speech Monday at the trade show, Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer rebutted that suggestion. "Nokia's support will help Windows Phone overall to build strength versus other mobile platforms," Steve Ballmer said. That's not just good for Nokia, that's good for all our handset partners. Steve Ballmer also demonstrated some of the improvements that are coming to Windows Phone 7 this year. They include a faster Web browser and quicker switching between applications.

it is right to give someone a second chance." Asked about the suggestion that Mr Andy Coulson had offered to quit, Mr David Cameron insisted he would not comment on "private conversations". Of course he, as anyone who is human would be, is extremely embarrassed by the endless publicity and speculation about what happened many years ago when he was editor of the News of the World. But he praised Mr Andy Coulson 's performance in his current role, saying the Downing Street press office worked in a very "proper" way and he had not received a single complaint.

hit 7-of-8 shots and was one of three Sixers to score 14 points. The return of Allen Iverson appeared to give Philadelphia a boost. Allen Iverson 's first game since Dec. 16 wasn't easy for the 34-year-old guard. Once I got my second wind I was all right. The first couple minutes I thought my heart was going to jump out of my chest, said Allen Iverson , who in 31 minutes also handed out five assists and collected four rebounds. who invest in U.S. Treasury bonds. "It's an IOU that is backed by Treasury bonds and the faith and credit of the United States government," said Barack Obama Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt. It is the same faith and credit that enables us to borrow from rich people and from China and from other countries. As you well know, in the history of this country, the United States has never defaulted on one penny owed to a creditor. Aaron Rodgers had what might be considered his national coming-out party off the field Monday night on CBS' "Late Show with David Letterman " and we saw all the same qualities. After the interview, David Letterman said, Let's just say, for the sake of this conversation, Aaron Rodgers had no athletic skills whatsoever.... Isn't he still the guy you'd want as quarterback? 's "ability to inspire" and the "inclusive nature of his campaign." Jimmy Carter Secretary of State Colin Powell says he is voting for Barack Obama . Jimmy Carter Secretary of State Colin Powell says he is voting for Barack Obama . He has both style and substance. I think he is a transformational figure, Colin Powell said on NBC's "Meet the Press." " Barack Obama displayed a steadiness. Showed intellectual vigor.
